definition: etiquette/(old) gradation of etiquette with social status
surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)

sentences.english: We must show all honours to the ambassadors of Caesar.
sentences.chinese: 对凯撒的使臣，我们可要礼数周全。

sentences.english: It is courtesy only absolutely cannot little.
She said that was an old tradition.
A smile when you are trying not to be rude.
sentences.chinese: 当您试着要不失礼数时的笑容。

sentences.english: With courtesy and with respect enough;
The Obama White House is rolling out the proverbial red carpet for Mr. Hu.
sentences.chinese: 此次奥巴马白宫团队在接待胡主席时可谓礼数周到。

sentences.english: Be genuine and polite in your message.
sentences.chinese: 你的信息一定要真诚，有礼数。

sentences.english: However, she has already exerted a gift number to go.
sentences.chinese: 不过，她尽了礼数就行了。

sentences.english: Now we have denounced the etiquette, trying to get rid of all of the detention.
sentences.chinese: 现在的我们痛斥礼数，试图摆脱所有的禁锢。

sentences.english: These Indigo children will not conform to the old ritual text book teachings.
sentences.chinese: 这些靛蓝儿童不会对旧有的礼数课本教学法顺从遵守。

sentences.english: With life often limited by rules and restrictions freedom for women was a rare commodity.
sentences.chinese: 她们的一生常常受制于礼数教条，自由遥不可及。

definition: to return a politeness/to present a gift in return
to treat sb with due respect (idiom)
to return a greeting/to send a gift in return
the younger generation/those who come after
to accept a gift/to acknowledge greetings
lit. compass and set square/fig. established standard/rule/customs/practices/fig. upright and honest/well-behaved
words of politeness/politesse/decorous talking/talk with propriety
